application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
description: Erection of a roof extension to provide four one-bedroom flats with associated parking
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.

Condition : 3 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (16/3026/0; 16/3026/1 (Rev A); 16/3026/2; 16/3026/3; 16/3026/4 (Rev 4); 16/3026/5 (Rev C); 16/3026/6 (Rev A)  Received:  20 August 2020) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 4 - Construction Working Hours
No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9:00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - Landscaping Details
No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscape works have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and these works shall be carried out as approved.  These details shall include (proposed finished levels or contours; means of enclosure including replacement of existing derelict boundary fencing; car parking layouts; other vehicle and pedestrian access and circulation areas; hard surfacing material; minor artefacts and structures (eg. furniture, play equipment, refuse or other storage units, signs, lighting etc); proposed and existing functional services above and below ground (eg drainage power, communications cables, pipelines etc. indicating lines, manholes, supports etc); retained historic landscape features and proposals for restoration, where relevant).
Soft landscape works shall include (planting plans; written specifications (including cultivation and other operations associated with plant and grass establishment); schedules of plants, noting species, plant sizes and proposed numbers/densities where appropriate; implementation programme).  
A Site Management Plan detailing a responsible owner and maintenance schedules for the proposed hard and soft landscaping, including for the regular removal of waste including litter and any fly tipping from the site, shall be submitted alongside required landscaping details, approved by the Local Planning Authority and permanently adhered to.

Condition : 6 - Parking
The car parking accommodation shown on the approved plans shall be provided before the dwellings hereby approved are first occupied and thereafter it shall not be used for any purpose other than the parking of vehicles.
No vehicles relating to the site shall be parked in or block access to the private access road serving the site, which is shared with other neighbouring properties, at any time accept for emergency vehicles.

Condition : 7 - Lifetime Homes
The development hereby permitted shall be designed and constructed in accordance with the Lifetime Home standards as set out in the London Plan Accessible London Supplementary Guidance.

Condition : 8 - Windows
The windows formed in the western elevation of the proposed mansard roof hereby approved, shall be obscure-glazed and non-opening unless parts of the window which can be opened are more than 1.7m above the floor of the room in which the window is installed and permanently retained as such.

Condition : 9 - Acoustic Insulation
No development shall take place until full details of acoustic insulation and associated ventilation measures have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and no unit shall be occupied until the approved details have been implemented. The details shall demonstrate that the maximum noise levels within the units shall not exceed the good limits contained in BS8233: 2014 (demonstrating compliance with BS8233:2014 noise limits as part of post-completion tests). These being LAeq, 16 hours (07:00-23:00) = 35dB in living rooms, 16 hours (07:00-23:00) = 40dB in dining rooms/areas, and 16 hours (07:00-23:00) = 35dB and 8 hours (23:00-7:00) = 30dB in the bedrooms.

Condition : 10 - Cycle Parking
Before the development commences, details (including manufacturers' specifications) of secure covered cycle parking facilities for the occupants of the development shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved facilities shall conform to current guidance such as the TfL London Cycling Design Standards in design and layout and be fully implemented and be made available for use before the first occupation of the development and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 11 - Electric Vehicle Charging
Before first occupation of the flats hereby approved, one active electric vehicle charging bay and one passive electric vehicle charging bay shall be provided and available for use and thereafter retained for the lifetime of the development.

Condition : 12 - Energy
The development hereby approved shall be implemented fully in accordance with the submitted and approved Energy Statement and permanently retained as such.  
Prior to the commencement of construction, the applicant must submit a roof plan, including the PV system design and a technical statement for the proposed PV system.  
Prior to the first occupation of the development, the applicant must submit an Air Tightness Technical Report, as referenced in the submitted Energy Statement, 'as built' SAP worksheets and an Energy Performance Certificate for approval by the Local Planning Authority.  
Prior to the first occupation of the development, suitable devices for monitoring the low and zero carbon technologies incorporated in the approved Energy Statement shall be installed and monitoring data shall be submitted to a monitoring online platform at daily intervals for a period of five years from the point of full operation.

Condition : 13 - Water
The water efficiency measures proposed within the Water Statement hereby approved shall be fully implemented and permanently retained as such to ensure that water usage is minimised to no more than 105 litres per person per day (excluding external water usage allowance).

Condition : 14 - Construction Materials
Prior to the first occupation of the development, evidence (including photographs and copies of delivery notes, invoices and installation contracts) shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority demonstrating that:
o At least 50% of timber and timber products used in the development's construction are sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) sources.  
o No construction or insulation materials used would release toxins into the internal and external environment, including gases which deplete stratospheric ozone.

Condition : 15 - Waste
Prior to the commencement of construction works all existing waste and debris, including household furniture, mattresses and appliances, dumped within the perimeter of the site shall be removed by the land owner.  
Prior to the first occupation of the development, a detailed design for the additional purpose built external waste and recycling store hereby approved, and a Waste Management Plan detailing how waste would be collected efficiently and safely by the Council written in consultation with the Council's Waste & Recycling Service, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, implemented and permanently retained as such.  
No waste, including bulky fly tipped household items, recyclable materials or bins related to the site shall be stored on the public highway, or the private shared access road serving the site and neighbouring properties under any circumstances at any time, other than for collection purposes agreed in and controlled by a Waste Management Plan approved by the Local Planning Authority.  
No waste, including bulky fly tipped household items, shall be stored or dumped within the perimeter of the site apart from within the waste storage area.  Bulky household waste, such as furniture, mattresses and appliances stored within the waste storage area shall be removed and responsibly disposed of or recycled by the property owner as quickly as practical.

Condition : 16 - Notwithstanding any details shown on the approved drawings, the development shall achieve a minimum internal floor to ceiling height of 2.5 metres for not less than 75% of the internal floor area.  If this requires an alteration to the external appearance of the development, the necessary details shall first be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.
